definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Tom: Bob, do you know tattoo?
Tom: Right, he can be a true tattoo lover.
sentences.chinese: 對啊，他可謂是一個地道的文身愛好者。

sentences.english: You got a tattoo again？No, kidding！
sentences.chinese: 你說我又紋了一個文身，真的嗎？

sentences.english: Milo has a star tattoo on his right bicep.
sentences.chinese: 的右手臂上有個星形的文身。

sentences.english: Why do so many Premier League footballers have tattoos these days?
sentences.chinese: 現在爲什麼有這麼多的英超球員開始文身？

sentences.english: Tattoo used to be a traditional custom among the Dai people.
sentences.chinese: 文身是傣族男子中的一種傳統習俗。

sentences.english: This blue-skinned ogre has dark designs painted on his body.
sentences.chinese: 這個藍色皮膚的食人魔身上帶有黑色的文身。

sentences.english: Tattoo of youngsters is the reflection of sub-cultural phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 現今青少年的文身是一種亞文化現象的反映。

definition: sleeveless garment (vest, waistcoat, singlet, tank top etc)/CL:件[jian4]
portrait (painting, photo etc)/(in a general sense) representation of a person/likeness
